Unhealthy plant-based diets do not provide benefits over diets including meat. A similar meta-analysis and systematic review also looked into dietary patterns and found that diets lower in animal foods and unhealthy plant foods, and higher in healthy plant foods are beneficial for CVD prevention. A 2018 meta-analysis of observational studies concluded that in most countries, a vegan diet is associated with a more favourable cardio-metabolic profile compared to an omnivorous diet. Evidence suggests that the Mediterranean diet may improve cardiovascular outcomes. There is also evidence that a Mediterranean diet may be more effective than a low-fat diet in bringing about long-term changes to cardiovascular risk factors Cardiovascular disease Cardiovascular disease

dialog: Hi Medi, I have a question about heart disease.
Of course! What would you like to know?
What are some lifestyle changes I can make to prevent heart disease?
A healthy diet rich in fruits and vegetables can decrease your risk of heart disease. Regular exercise and quitting smoking are also important.
Can you give me more details about a heart-healthy diet?

A heart-healthy diet includes plenty of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean protein, and healthy fats like omega-3s from fish. Limit your intake of saturated and trans fats, added sugars, and sodium.
Okay, I see. And what type of exercise is best for heart health?
Aerobic exercise, such as brisk walking, cycling, or swimming, is great for heart health. Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week.
Thank you, Medi. That was very helpful.

dialog: Hi Medi, I just had a stent placed in my heart. What should I do to take care of myself?
Congratulations on taking care of your heart health! After a stent placement, it's important to rest and avoid strenuous activity for a few days.
How should I change my diet?

A heart-healthy diet is still important. Eat plenty of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean protein, and healthy fats. Limit your intake of saturated and trans fats, added sugars, and sodium. Avoid caffeine and alcohol.
What about exercise?
Start with light physical activity like walking and gradually increase your intensity over time. Aim for at least 30 minutes a day most days of the week.
Thank you, Medi. That's helpful.
You're welcome! Remember to follow your doctor's instructions and take any prescribed medications as directed.
Will do, Medi. Thanks again for your help.
